{"step_by_step_thinking": "Puberty is a complex process that involves a series of hormonal changes. GnRH, GH, and Insulin all play important roles in puberty, but they are not considered permissive. Leptin, on the other hand, is a hormone that is produced by fat cells and has a permissive role in puberty. It allows the initiation of puberty by signaling to the brain that there is enough energy reserve for the process to begin.", "answer_choice": "A"}
